    <title>Powered by L-Soft's LISTSERV mailing list manager</title>     <link>http://www.lsoft.com/products/listserv-powered.asp</link>     <url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;c6f4153f.1503">   <title>Re: generation of DOIs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;c6f4153f.1503</link>   <description> Hi Angus,<br>Apologies - I have clearly misunderstood the question. I thought it referred to BL DataCite.<br>Thanks for clarifying!<br><br>On 11 Mar 2015 17:33, Angus Whyte &lt;a.whyte@ED.AC.UK&gt; wrote:<br>Hi Guiseppe,<br><br>Figshare offers DataCite DOIs, which are minted in the US through the<br>California Digital Library's EZID service. Also I believe Figshare offer<br>some flexibility in the requirements you mention. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T20:30:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Giuseppe Sollazzo</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;c6f4153f.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;a9f73eb5.1503">   <title>Re: generation of DOIs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;a9f73eb5.1503</link>   <description> Hi Rachel,<br><br>As well as the institution being responsible for the persistence of the<br>DOIs it owns, the rationale for Loughborough is being consistently<br>identified as the publisher of its data in the Datacite metadata<br>catalogue, for the visibility and ease of impact tracking that offers<br>them, is that right? I'm also wondering what other factors, if there<br>are any, would make it difficult to move from a service that was<br>registering DOIs on behalf of an institution (some years later as in<br>your scenario)? [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T10:50:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Angus Whyte</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;a9f73eb5.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;c38c6975.1503">   <title>High Level Training Course on ISO 16363 for Managers of Digital Repositories Den Haag 18 - 22 May 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;c38c6975.1503</link>   <description> [cid:image001.jpg@01CF8FD9.62E87370]High Level Training Course on ISO 16363 for Managers of Digital Repositories Den Haag, The Netherlands - 18-22 May 2015.<br><br>I'm pleased to announce another opportunity to learn, from the authors, about the three standards which are fundamental for trustworthy digital repositories. These important ISO standards are:<br><br>* ISO 14721:2012 (OAIS&lt;http://www.oais.info&gt; - a reference model for what is required for an archive to provide long-term preservation of digital information)<br>* ISO 16363&lt;http://www.iso16363.org/standards/iso-16363/&gt;:2013 (Audit and certification of trustworthy digital repositories - sets out comprehensive metrics for what an archive must do, based on OAIS)<br>* ISO 16919<http://www.iso16363.org/standards/iso-16919/>:2014 (Requirements for bodies providing [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T10:17:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>David Giaretta</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;c38c6975.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9289f6ca.1503">   <title>Re: generation of DOIs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9289f6ca.1503</link>   <description> Hi All,<br><br>I just wanted to jump in on this thread RE figshare to clarify, Loughborough have been working directly with us at the BL for their DOIs for their data held by figshare. I have worked with Loughborough to set them up a DataCite account and figshare will then be using Loughborough's DOI prefix to mint DOIs for Loughborough's data. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T09:40:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>datasets</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9289f6ca.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9c288cb8.1503">   <title>OR2015 NEWS: Registration Opens; Speakers from Mozilla and Google Announced </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9c288cb8.1503</link>   <description> March 11, 2015<br><br>Read it online: http://bit.ly/1wtSm4j<br><br>Contact: http://www.or2015.net/contact-us<br><br>OR2015 NEWS: Registration Opens; Speakers from Mozilla and Google Announced<br><br>We are pleased to announce that registration is now open for the 10th International Conference on Open Repositories, to be held on June 8-11, 2015 in Indianapolis, Indiana, United States of America. Full registration details and a link to the registration form may be found at: http://www.or2015.net/registration [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T08:38:25+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Elin Stangeland</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9c288cb8.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;4307f8b.1503">   <title>Re: generation of DOIs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;4307f8b.1503</link>   <description> John,<br><br>We are looking to build an institutional data repository and will be developing our own ingest module<br><br>Part of this would be the generation of a DOI<br><br>Ricky   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T18:58:41+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Richard Rankin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;4307f8b.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;e641d650.1503">   <title>Re: generation of DOIs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;e641d650.1503</link>   <description> Hi Ricky<br><br>Yes, of course, you would be buying an off the shelf repository with DOI minting capabilities and associated costs. If you already have a repository you are happy with then it would make sense to integrate DataCite into that.<br><br>My previous message was really outlining the distinction between the institutional and open figshare offers and that they can meet funder requirements. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T17:43:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>John Kaye</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;e641d650.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;8fa2eaa9.1503">   <title>Re: generation of DOIs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;8fa2eaa9.1503</link>   <description> John,<br><br>Does that not make it more expensive as you would be purchasing a system that used datacite - would they not be passing on the cost of datacite?<br><br>Ricky<br><br>Tel: o289o973955<br>Information Services<br>71 University Road<br>Queen's University Belfast<br>Belfast BT7 1NF<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Research Data Management discussion list [mailto:RESEARCH-DATAMAN@jiscmail.ac.uk] On Behalf Of John Kaye<br>Sent: 11 March 2015 17:25<br>To: RESEARCH-DATAMAN@jiscmail.ac.uk<br>Subject: Re: generation of DOIs [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T17:33:46+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Richard Rankin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;8fa2eaa9.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;3630a770.1503">   <title>Re: generation of DOIs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;3630a770.1503</link>   <description> Hi Guiseppe,<br><br>Figshare offers DataCite DOIs, which are minted in the US through the<br>California Digital Library's EZID service. Also I believe Figshare offer<br>some flexibility in the requirements you mention.<br><br>best wishes,<br><br>Angus<br><br>On 11/03/2015 17:14, Antony Corfield [awc] wrote:<br>&gt; Hi Ricky, we're advising that researchers deposit in repositories recommended by funders or in Pure. I'm not sure figshare can meet many of the requirements (e.g. where data is stored, upload/download times, metadata etc.). Datacite gives you a DOI (via BL), pure and simple..<br>&gt; Antony<br>&gt;<br>&gt; On 11 Mar 2015, at 16:55, Giuseppe Sollazzo wrote:<br>&gt;<br> [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T17:32:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Angus Whyte</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;3630a770.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9a0a1afe.1503">   <title>Re: generation of DOIs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9a0a1afe.1503</link>   <description> Hi Antony<br><br>Figshare do have an institutional offer, which acts as an internal institutional repository for data as opposed to their open website (I think Loughborough and a couple of others use this). This offer seems to be customisable and lets you choose your own storage options, tailor your metadata and also choose where your DOI is minted e.g. a BL UK DOI or using EZID from California Digital Library. The DOI is still going to be DataCite one though. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T17:25:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>John Kaye</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9a0a1afe.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b5d6245d.1503">   <title>Re: generation of DOIs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b5d6245d.1503</link>   <description> Hi Ricky, we're advising that researchers deposit in repositories recommended by funders or in Pure. I'm not sure figshare can meet many of the requirements (e.g. where data is stored, upload/download times, metadata etc.). Datacite gives you a DOI (via BL), pure and simple..<br>Antony<br><br>On 11 Mar 2015, at 16:55, Giuseppe Sollazzo wrote: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T17:14:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Antony Corfield [awc]</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b5d6245d.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;47eedebf.1503">   <title>Re: generation of DOIs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;47eedebf.1503</link>   <description> Hi Ricky<br><br>I think most people are looking to DataCite for this, there aren't that many registration agencies that can mint DOI's, there is a list here:<br><br>http://www.doi.org/registration_agencies.html<br><br>There are a large number of crossref dataset DOI's in existence, mainly because crossref were active before DataCite existed. ICPSR in the US used crossref DOI's for their data until last year, but have now migrated to DataCite. I know some UK institutions use crossref for articles, theses etc. and have considered using it for datasets, however the metadata schema isn't really tailored for datasets like the DataCite schema. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T17:01:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>John Kaye</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;47eedebf.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;2560cbc3.1503">   <title>Re: generation of DOIs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;2560cbc3.1503</link>   <description> Hi Ricky,<br>we are still evaluating what to do so cannot comment much about the real use cases, but we're considering FigShare and Datacite.<br>You know Datacite. Figshare offers many extra functions that go way beyond FOI (hosting, hosting + Arkivum, statistics, data linking, etc.), which might be suitable in a context where these applications/features are absent and not easily implementable in the corporate environment. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T16:55:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Giuseppe Sollazzo</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;2560cbc3.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;eedf9837.1503">   <title>generation of DOIs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;eedf9837.1503</link>   <description> Would be interested to know if anyone is using a service other than datacite to generate DOIs for datasets<br><br>Ricky<br><br>Tel: o289o973955<br>Information Services<br>71 University Road<br>Queen's University Belfast<br>Belfast BT7 1NF   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T16:42:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Richard Rankin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;eedf9837.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;277771f0.1503">   <title>Job vacancy: Head of Research and Development Department at SUB Goettingen </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;277771f0.1503</link>   <description> *** Apologies for cross postings ***<br><br>Dear all,<br><br>The Goettingen State and University Library invites applications for the Head of the Research and Development Department. We are heavily engaged in international and national and local projects on the development of research and information infrastructures for digital humanities, research data management, virtual research environments and further research driven topics. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T15:17:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Strathmann, Stefan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;277771f0.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9f859468.1503">   <title>Re: Data from collaborations </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9f859468.1503</link>   <description> Hello Mary,<br><br>Just one small suggestion - please note the small amount of text in paragraph 2 that has been removed from the end. I don't think it loses clarity or meaning, but it does make it easier to read and understand.<br><br>Kind regards,<br>Alexandra.<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Research Data Management discussion list [mailto:RESEARCH-DATAMAN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Mary Donaldson<br>Sent: 09 March 2015 13:59<br>To: RESEARCH-DATAMAN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Data from collaborations [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T12:36:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bowmer, Alexandra</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9f859468.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;2340eb94.1503">   <title>Re: Examples of good and bad RDM </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;2340eb94.1503</link>   <description> Thank you for the encouraging response, especially those who have submitted contributions or comments.<br><br>I will add my voice to Dorothea’s - if you can select one of her pinned items that appeals to you or think will appeal to those you engage with, you can add another layer of value through a short description of the main topic and summary points, selecting some tags and categories, and submitting it to the blog. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T12:25:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Monica Duke</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;2340eb94.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9f57ce08.1503">   <title>Call for papers - MTSR 2015 Special Track on Metadata & Semantics for Open Repositories, Research Information Systems and Data Infrastructures </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9f57ce08.1503</link>   <description> ======= Apologies for cross-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdposting =======<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS<br><br>MTSR 2015 - Special Track on Metadata &amp; Semantics for Open Repositories,<br>Research Information Systems and Data Infrastructures<br><br>http://mtsr-conf.org/index.php/tracks/open-repositories<br><br>Aim and Scope<br>-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>The sharing and re-use of research information is becoming an<br>increasingly important aspect of scientific activity. Text publications<br>are traditionally the main way of publishing research output and<br>challenges still exist for their optimal recording and dissemination.<br>Scientific communities increasingly recognise the immense significance<br>of storing, discovering, processing, preserving and re-using data sets<br>as well as other types of research objects like workflows and software.<br>Furthermore, Public Sector Information, [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T09:22:52+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nikos Houssos</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;9f57ce08.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;5f244442.1503">   <title>Re: Data from collaborations </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;5f244442.1503</link>   <description> Hello,<br><br>I've had a meeting with our contracts department and we now have a working text to put into collaboration agreements. I thought that I'd share what we've come up with in case this is an issue any of you are considering at the moment.<br><br>For agreements with other HEIs:<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThe Parties hereto hereby acknowledge their obligations regarding data curation and sharing (available at:[ http://www.epsrc.ac.uk/about/standards/researchdata/expectations/ / http://www.rcuk.ac.uk/RCUK-prod/assets/documents/documents/RCUKOpenAccessPolicy.pdf] and each Party hereby consents to the other Parties taking such actions and making all returns as the Parties agree are reasonably appropriate and necessary hereunder.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T13:58:38+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mary Donaldson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;5f244442.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;d87c298c.1503">   <title>Merger of Databib and re3data.org, first version of API available </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;d87c298c.1503</link>   <description> *** Apologies for cross-posting. ***<br><br>Dear Colleagues,<br><br>on the occasion of the Research Data Alliance\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Fifth Plenary Meeting [1], we are pleased to report progress in the consolidation of the Databib and re3data.org initiatives into a shared registry and website and to announce the availability of an Application Programming Interface (API) to enable machine access to the merged registry. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T14:28:37+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Heinz Pampel</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;d87c298c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;8b28262d.1503">   <title>Re: Examples of good and bad RDM </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;8b28262d.1503</link>   <description> I have just added good practices of 3TU.Datacentrum to the data stories website. I guess it has to be reviewed first to be shown on the site?<br><br>I hope you can collect a lot more RDM stories at RDA. Good luck!<br><br>Kind regards,<br>Annemiek<br><br>Annemiek van der Kuil<br>Research Data Officer | 3TU.Datacentrum | TU Delft Library | Research Data Services<br>T +31 (0)15 27 85 540 | E a.vanderkuil@tudelft.nl&lt;mailto:a.vanderkuil@tudelft.nl&gt;<br>T +31 (0)15 27 88 600 | E datacentrum@3tu.nl | W datacentrum.3tu.nl&lt;http://datacentrum.3tu.nl/&gt; [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T11:59:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Annemiek van der Kuil</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;8b28262d.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;cbd8d731.1503">   <title>4C Roadmap for Digital Preservation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;cbd8d731.1503</link>   <description> Hi Everyone.<br><br>Following on from the successful launch last year of the draft digital preservation roadmap &quot;Investing in Curation, a shared path to sustainability&quot; and an extensive stakeholder consultation the 4C project has now released the final version of the roadmap. In the document we put forward the vision that...<br><br>"In five years time (2020) it will be easier to design or procure more cost effective and efficient digital curation services because the costs, benefits and the business cases for doing so will be more widely understood across the curation lifecycle and by all relevant stakeholders. Cost modelling will be [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T08:45:55+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Paul Stokes</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;cbd8d731.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;8d3f2c9e.1503">   <title>Data Manager Vacancy at University College Dublin (UCD) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;8d3f2c9e.1503</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>We are looking to recruit a Data Manager in UCD Library.<br><br>This is a permanent position which will focus significantly on the<br>coordination and development of services in the area of discovery, use and<br>management of data. It is a new post which will offer great scope for an<br>individual to provide leadership in the development of this new service<br>area. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-08T11:17:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Julia Barrett</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;8d3f2c9e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;42709ffb.1503">   <title>CILIP's Copyright Executive Briefing - Early Bird ends 11 March </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;42709ffb.1503</link>   <description> The University of Edinburgh is a charitable body, registered in<br>Scotland, with registration number SC005336.    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T14:17:38+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Martin Donnelly</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;42709ffb.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;427ec92c.1503">   <title>Research Data Manager Vacancy at St Andrews </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;427ec92c.1503</link>   <description> We are looking for an enthusiastic, experienced and highly motivated person to join our new Digital Research Division as Research Data Manager. This is an opportunity to help influence the development of services and systems within this brand new Division of the University Library, which includes support for Open Access, Digital Humanities and Research Data Management. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T14:44:24+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Anna Clements</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;427ec92c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;322e8910.1503">   <title>Fwd: [rda-legalinterop-ig] Workshop on open licenses </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;322e8910.1503</link>   <description> The announcement below, original sent to the CODATA-RDA Group on Legal Interoperability may be of interest to the wider audience on this list.<br><br>With very best wishes,<br><br>Simon.    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T05:20:16-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>CODATA ED</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;322e8910.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;8f1ff631.1503">   <title>Fwd: Save the Date - Dryad Community Meeting, 27 May, American Geophysical Union, Washington DC </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;8f1ff631.1503</link>   <description> The Dryad Community Meeting is a valuable occasion to engage with an important an innovative initiative that is transforming research practice and providing a platform for publishing data underpinning research articles.<br><br>Save the date and come and find out more! Dryad Community Meeting, 27 May, American Geophysical Union, Washington DC.<br><br>With very best wishes, [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T05:13:57-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>CODATA ED</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;8f1ff631.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b46d1ec9.1503">   <title>Re: Managing Sensitive Data </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b46d1ec9.1503</link>   <description> Thanks Sarah,<br><br>Indeed yes. Leeds is establishing LIDA (http://www.lida.leeds.ac.uk/), an institute for data analytics that gets those working on CDRC and those working on the MRC Centre for Medical Bioinformatics projects (and others working on other things) in the same physical space. It should be a good place to have meetings and bring people and ideas together. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T12:34:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andy Turner</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b46d1ec9.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;23ce8d30.1503">   <title>Re: EPSRC Expectations Awareness Survey </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;23ce8d30.1503</link>   <description> We would be interested as well Stuart, we are currently doing EPSRC focussed RDM workshops (with a very good response rate) but a survey (and its results) might also be very useful.<br><br>Best wishes,<br>Masud<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Research Data Management discussion list [mailto:RESEARCH-DATAMAN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of stuart macdonald<br>Sent: 05 March 2015 11:35<br>To: RESEARCH-DATAMAN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: EPSRC Expectations Awareness Survey [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T12:31:49+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Khokhar, Masud</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;23ce8d30.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;e51cbd9c.1503">   <title>Re: EPSRC Expectations Awareness Survey </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;e51cbd9c.1503</link>   <description> Thanks Valerie. Yes, it would be useful to share findings and chat<br>further next week.<br><br>All best,<br>Stuart<br><br>On 05/03/2015 11:09, Valerie McCutcheon wrote:<br>&gt; Thanks Stuart,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; We did a survey and interviews a while back which were very useful. We have been meeting with EPSRC award holders in particular more recently.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; We are hoping to host some kind of get together/workshop soon on RDM so maybe sharing issues found might be a useful part of that.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Maybe catch a chat with you re this next week when we are over with you.<br>&gt;<br> [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T11:35:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>stuart macdonald</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;e51cbd9c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;ec8a5f33.1503">   <title>Re: EPSRC Expectations Awareness Survey </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;ec8a5f33.1503</link>   <description> Thanks Stuart,<br><br>We did a survey and interviews a while back which were very useful. We have been meeting with EPSRC award holders in particular more recently.<br><br>We are hoping to host some kind of get together/workshop soon on RDM so maybe sharing issues found might be a useful part of that. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T11:09:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Valerie McCutcheon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;ec8a5f33.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;7793a97a.1503">   <title>Re: Managing Sensitive Data </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;7793a97a.1503</link>   <description> Hi Andy et al,<br><br>Andy is no doubt aware of this given his connections at Leeds (see CDRC, part-located at Leeds Uni http://cdrc.ac.uk/) - but for everyone else's info, the ESRC's Big Data Network programme may be of interest, as the Phase 1 projects are looking specifically at sensitive and confidential data (ADRN http://adrn.ac.uk/) and the Phase 2 projects are working closely with them (we are one) where researchers using our services wish to use (and possibly create) confidential data (BDN2 http://www.esrc.ac.uk/research/major-investments/Big-Data/BDN-Phase2.aspx). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T10:49:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sarah Currier</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;7793a97a.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;3380432.1503">   <title>EPSRC Expectations Awareness Survey </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;3380432.1503</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>As many of you will already know EPSRC set out its research data<br>management (RDM) expectations for institutions in receipt of EPSRC grant<br>funding in April 2012, this included the development of an institutional<br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdRoadmap\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. EPSRC assessment of compliance with these expectations will<br>begin on 1 May 2015 for research outputs published on or after that date. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T10:20:16+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>stuart macdonald</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;3380432.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;4026dc32.1503">   <title>Re: Managing Sensitive Data </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;4026dc32.1503</link>   <description> Andy, I'm not in the UK but am interested in the outcomes of the project.<br>Based on web searches and policies shared by some of my colleagues, it<br>seems that most institutional data security policies utilize a 3- or<br>4-class categorization of institutional data, which might not be aligned<br>with research data or the processes and infrastructure associated with<br>research practices. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T13:31:30-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Brian Westra</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;4026dc32.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b3356d3.1503">   <title>Re: Examples of good and bad RDM </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b3356d3.1503</link>   <description> Hi,<br><br>we'll be further talking about how to collect data stories at the RDA<br>plenary and later at the IASSIST conference in June, so any feedback or<br>pointers would be very helpful. It's a time-consuming effort, but together<br>we can compile a great resource that is useful in outreach, teaching, and<br>research.<br><br>Any contribution, whether it's picking a story from Dorothea's list, making<br>suggestions on site and policies, or sending us news and photos will be<br>greatly appreciated! [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T12:44:18-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Inna Kouper</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b3356d3.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item pleased to have the community plunder my linkspam lists<br>for stories for the blog:<br><br>https://pinboard.in/u:dsalo/t:horrorstories/<br>https://pinboard.in/u:dsalo/t:successstory/<br><br>Very glad to see this happening!<br><br>Dorothea<br><br>On 3/4/15 8:36 AM, Monica Duke wrote:<br>&gt; Thanks to all those who have offered help and suggestions for the data stories site so far. data stories is a blog co-ordinated by the DCC and the RDA Engagement interest group to help collate and publish stories of RDM, as suggested in this thread over recent months.<br>&gt;<br>> We hope [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T10:36:45-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Dorothea Salo</dc:creator> rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;2306c754.1503">   <title>Re: Examples of good and bad RDM </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;2306c754.1503</link>   <description> Thanks to all those who have offered help and suggestions for the data stories site so far. data stories is a blog co-ordinated by the DCC and the RDA Engagement interest group to help collate and publish stories of RDM, as suggested in this thread over recent months.<br><br>We hope that the blog will truly be an international effort and we are trialling a form to collect stories, which can be accessed from the blog:<br>http://datastories.jiscinvolve.org/ [...]    </description> Digital Scholarship Support Officer (maternity cover) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;413cc5eb.1503</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>The Bodleian Libraries are seeking to appoint a Digital Scholarship Support Office (maternity cover) to set up and run the ORA-Data service at a critical time for Research Data Management for the University. The ORA-Data service is currently in pilot mode and will be transitioning to production service over the coming year. We're going to be delivering a 2 hour<br>training course on Working with Personal and Sensitive Data, with a view not<br>only on managing, but also sharing some anonymised form of the data. Cliff<br>Lynch in his talk at IDCC15 last month identified this as the most important<br>current barrier to resolve for data sharing. It certainly is an important<br>one at our institution. On 4 Mar 2015, at 00:55, Andy Turner &lt;A.G.D.Turner@LEEDS.AC.UK&gt; wrote:<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Hi,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; (Apologies for cross posting and if the RDA posting is barking up the wrong tree (and if so please direct me).)<br>&gt;<br>> As part of the UK Jisc Research Data Spring (http://www.jisc.ac.uk/rd/projects/research-data-spring) I have got involved in planning a project that if funded will look at classifying sensitive research data and mapping this [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T07:18:13+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>John Milner</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;e41f369e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;92577f1.1503">   <title>[rda-legalinterop-ig] Managing Sensitive Data </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;92577f1.1503</link>   <description> Hi,<br><br>(Apologies for cross posting and if the RDA posting is barking up the wrong tree (and if so please direct me).)<br><br>As part of the UK Jisc Research Data Spring (http://www.jisc.ac.uk/rd/projects/research-data-spring) I have got involved in planning a project that if funded will look at classifying sensitive research data and mapping this onto storage options for these data at different parts of the research data life-cycle. The main output from this work would be some guidance documentation aimed at UK institutions and researchers that are to be disseminated by the UK Digital Curation Centre. The early phases of the [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T00:57:28+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>agdturner</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;92577f1.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;92577f1.1503">   <title>Managing Sensitive Data </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;92577f1.1503</link>   <description> Hi,<br><br>(Apologies for cross posting and if the RDA posting is barking up the wrong tree (and if so please direct me).)<br><br>As part of the UK Jisc Research Data Spring (http://www.jisc.ac.uk/rd/projects/research-data-spring) I have got involved in planning a project that if funded will look at classifying sensitive research data and mapping this onto storage options for these data at different parts of the research data life-cycle. The main output from this work would be some guidance documentation aimed at UK institutions and researchers that are to be disseminated by the UK Digital Curation Centre. The early phases of the [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T23:55:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andy Turner</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;92577f1.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b0df42e6.1503">   <title>Re: RESEARCH-DATAMAN Digest - 26 Feb 2015 to 2 Mar 2015 (#2015-38) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RESEARCH-DATAMAN;b0df42e6.1503</link>   <description> ** Apologies for Duplicate Cross-Posting **<br><br>Annual Dataverse Community Meeting - June 9-11 at Harvard University,<br>Cambridge, MA.<br><br>You are cordially invited to take part in the Annual Dataverse Community<br>Meeting &lt;http://projects.iq.harvard.edu/dataverse-community-meeting/&gt;,<br>hosted by the Institute for Quantitative Social Science (IQSS)<br>&lt;http://www.iq.harvard.edu/&gt;, which includes a pre-meeting Repositories<br>Workshop<br>&lt;http://projects.iq.harvard.edu/dataverse-community-meeting/repositories-wo<br>rkshop&gt; on June 9th and a two-day Community Meeting<br>&lt;http://projects.iq.harvard.edu/dataverse-community-meeting/agenda&gt; on<br>June 10th and 11th at Harvard University, Cambridge, MA.
